src:
Prednosti gibanja
Aktiven življenjski slog prispeva k ohranjanju oziroma izboljšanju našega zdravja ter preventivno deluje pred pojavom različnih zdravstvenih zapletov.
07 Nov 2019, 09:01 by U. S.



S plavanjem razgibamo prav vse mišice v telesu, primerno je za mlade in stare. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Naj vam sneg in mraz ne prideta do živega! FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



Da bi ohranili zdravje v starosti, začnimo že v mladosti. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Marsikdo se vsako leto med božično-novoletnimi prazniki zredi, v novem letu pa ga pričaka popraznična depresija. Strokovnjaki trdijo, da je najboljše zdravilo proti obojemu gibanje. Ne le da topi kilograme, temveč tudi izboljšuje razpoloženje. Deluje lahko kot antidepresiv, pravijo nekateri psihiatri. Spodbuja rast novih živčnih celic v hipokampusu, ta proces pa je ključen za zdravljenje depresije, pravijo in še, da rešuje možganske celice pred odmiranjem ter niža tveganje demence.
Po podatkih SZO je telesna nedejavnost četrti glavni dejavnik tveganja za splošno umrljivost (6 % smrti).
Pri starejših, ki so redno telesno aktivni, je volumen hipokampusa, ki je povezan z učenjem in pomnjenjem, dva odstotka večji kot pri njihovih neaktivnih vrstnikih, je pokazala raziskava iz leta 2011, objavljena v Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences. Strokovnjaki trdijo, da ljudje, ki so redno telesno aktivni, bolje načrtujejo in organizirajo svoje življenje. 
Zdrav duh in telo


Naj vam sneg in mraz ne prideta do živega! FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

A z gibanjem seveda ne ohranjamo le mentalnega zdravja, temveč tudi fizično, denimo kosti. S staranjem se kakovost kosti slabša, pojavlja se osteoporoza. A to lahko preprečimo oziroma ublažimo prav z rednim gibanjem. Zdravniki priporočajo tek, hojo, planinarjenje, ples in tenis. Krepitev mišične mase koristi zdravju kosti. Če že imate osteoporozo, poskrbite za močne mišice, da boste lahko ohranjali ravnotežje in znižali tveganje padcev, ki so lahko pri tej bolezni usodni. Oboleli za osteoporozo naj se sprehaja kako uro najmanj dvakrat na teden. Gibanje seveda niža tveganje srčnožilnih bolezni, ki na leto povzročijo 17,5 milijona smrti v svetu. Da bi zbolevanje preprečili, bodimo aktivni in tudi tisti, ki imajo težave s srcem, bi morali migati, da bi prelisičili prezgodnjo smrt. Zdravniki tem priporočajo aerobno vadbo oziroma lahen tek in hojo. Ameriška študija je pokazala, da telesna aktivnost trikrat na teden po pol ure niža tveganje razvoja bolezni srca.To seveda niso edine prednosti gibanja. Večkrat smo že zapisali, da lahko z njim uspešno krotimo stres. Stresni hormoni lahko močno bremenijo srce, gibanje pa pomaga pri sprostitvi ter posledično blažitvi stresa. V kombinaciji z vajami za moč lahko redna aerobna vadba niža tveganje nastanka diabetesa, in to za več kot 50 odstotkov, kažejo raziskave, a pri tem nikar ne pozabite na pomen pravilne, zdrave, uravnotežene prehrane. Nujna je za vzdrževanje zdrave teže, z njo in gibanjem boste višek kilogramov stopili in poskrbeli za zdravje srca in vsega telesa.
Sprehod, plavanje, taj či


Da bi ohranili zdravje v starosti, začnimo že v mladosti. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Torej, bodite aktivni, če je le mogoče, vsak dan. Svetovna zdravstvena organizacija zdravim odraslim priporoča izvajanje vsaj 150 minut zmerne telesne dejavnosti na teden, kar pomeni 30 minut na dan večino dni v tednu ali 75 minut visoko intenzivne telesne dejavnosti na teden oziroma 25 minut vsaj tri dni v tednu. Kombinira se lahko telesno dejavnost obeh intenzivnosti. Sešteva se tudi telesna dejavnost, razdeljena na krajša časovna obdobja, vendar aktivnosti ne smejo trajati manj kot 10 minut. Otrokom in mladostnikom SZO svetuje vsaj 60 minut zmerne telesne do visoko intenzivne telesne dejavnosti vsak dan. Vadba naj vam bo všeč, ni vam treba v fitnes, če vam ni do tega, pojdite na sprehod.
Telesno dejavnost načrtujmo v skladu z vremensko napovedjo in svojimi sposobnostmi.
Ampak v tem mrazu se vam res ne ljubi ven, pravite? Pa bi se morali prisiliti! Hoja je resda zelo preprosta, a tudi zelo učinkovita. Z njo ohranjate optimalni krvni tlak, krepite kosti, dvigate razpoloženje in nižate tveganje nastanka različnih bolezni, kot je diabetes. Vsi bi morali hoditi, so prepričani strokovnjaki, prav tako plavati. S plavanjem razgibamo prav vse mišice v telesu, hkrati si krepimo mentalno zdravje, blažimo stres in odganjamo slabo voljo. Priporočajo tudi treninge moči, s katerimi ne porabimo le obilo kalorij in povečamo mišice, temveč smo tudi mentalno močnejši, ohranjali naj bi namreč možganske funkcije pri starejših ljudeh. Niti na keglove vaje ne smemo pozabiti. Zaradi njih sicer resda ne bomo videti bolje, bodo pa zato krepkejše mišice medeničnega dna, kar je zelo pomembno za preprečevanje inkontinence. Ne le ženske, tudi moški bi jih morali redno delati. Za telo in duha je odlična vadba taj či, borilna veščina, ki kombinira gibanje in sproščanje; primerna je za vse starosti in kondicije, predvsem pa naj bi koristila starejšim.
text:
The benefits of movement
An active lifestyle contributes to maintaining or improving our health and preventively preventing various health complications.
07 Nov 2019, 09:01 by U. S.



Swimming stretches all the muscles in the body, suitable for young and old. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



Don't let the snow and cold get you alive! PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



In order to maintain old age health, let's start at a young age. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Many people grow up each year during the Christmas and New Year holidays, and in the New Year, they expect a festive depression. Experts say the best cure for both is movement. Not only does it lose weight, it also improves mood. It can act as an antidepressant, some psychiatrists say. It stimulates the growth of new nerve cells in the hippocampus, and this process is key to treating depression, they say, and it saves brain cells from dying and lowers the risk of dementia.
According to WHO, physical inactivity is the fourth major risk factor for overall mortality (6% of deaths).
Elderly people who are physically active have a learning and memory-related volume of two percent higher than their inactive peers, according to a 2011 study published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences. Experts say that people who are physically active regularly plan and organize their lives better.
Healthy body and mind


Don't let the snow and cold get you alive! PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

But of course, with movement, we not only maintain mental health, but also physically, such as bones. With aging, bone quality deteriorates and osteoporosis occurs. But this can be prevented or mitigated by regular movement. Doctors recommend running, walking, hiking, dancing and tennis. Strengthening muscle mass benefits bone health. If you already have osteoporosis, make sure you have strong muscles so that you can maintain balance and reduce the risk of falls that can be fatal to the disease. Patients with osteoporosis should walk for an hour at least twice a week. The movement, of course, lowers the risk of cardiovascular disease, which causes 17.5 million deaths annually worldwide. To prevent illness, let's be active, and even those with heart problems should blink to overcome the untimely death. Doctors recommend aerobic exercise or light running and walking. An American study found that exercising three times a week after half an hour reduced the risk of developing heart disease. These are not the only benefits of exercise, of course. We have written many times before that we can successfully manage stress with it. Stress hormones can have a heavy burden on the heart, and movement helps to release and, consequently, relieve stress. Combined with strength training, regular aerobic exercise can lower your risk of diabetes by more than 50 percent, according to research, but do not overlook the importance of a proper, healthy, balanced diet. It is essential for maintaining a healthy weight, and with it and exercise, you will gain extra pounds and take care of heart and whole body health.
Walking, swimming, that chi


In order to maintain old age health, let's start at a young age. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

So, be active, if possible, every day. The World Health Organization recommends that healthy adults exercise at least 150 minutes of moderate physical activity per week, which means 30 minutes a day most days of the week or 75 minutes of high-intensity physical activity per week, or 25 minutes at least three days a week. The physical activity of both intensities can be combined. Physical activity is also summed up, divided into shorter periods of time, but the activity should not last less than 10 minutes. WHO advises children and adolescents at least 60 minutes of moderate to high intensity physical activity each day. You should like exercise, you don't need to go to the gym, if you don't feel like it, go for a walk.
Plan your physical activity according to the weather forecast and your abilities.
But in this cold you really don't like getting out, you say? So you should force yourself! Walking is really very simple, but also very effective. It maintains optimal blood pressure, strengthens bones, elevates mood and lowers the risk of various diseases such as diabetes. We should all be walking, experts are convinced, also swimming. By swimming, we flex all the muscles in the body, and at the same time strengthen our mental health, alleviate stress and repel bad mood. They also recommend strength training that not only consumes a lot of calories and increases muscle mass, but is also mentally stronger, preserving brain function in older people. Neither should we forget the bowling exercises. Although they may not look better, they will therefore strengthen the pelvic floor muscles, which is very important to prevent incontinence. Not only women, men should do them regularly. For the body and the mind, perfect Tai Chi training is a martial art that combines movement and relaxation; it is suitable for all ages and fitness, but above all benefits older people.
